intro: Crepis novae-zelandiae, commonly known as the New Zealand mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers and hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy areas and is adapted to the temperate climate of its native habitat. It has a low-growing habit and produces seeds that are dispersed by wind. Crepis novae-zelandiae is often found in coastal and inland regions, contributing to the local biodiversity.
